location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.108 of 1851 from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: Covering letter with enclosure (a report from Commodore Porter, Commanding Officer of the Indian Naval Squadron) reporting on the squadron's activities on the coast of Qatar. Hennell reports that the squadron's visit to El Adeed [al 'Udayd], and the exploration of its backwaters, had an 'excellent effect' upon the inhabitants of the region. Hennell also writes that the survey of the port at Biddah [al Bidda] appears 'very complete' and will be of great use in future.
